definition: surname Mi/name of an ancient state
the West/abbr. for Spain 西班牙[Xi1 ban1 ya2]/Spanish
root/basis/classifier for long slender objects, e.g. cigarettes, guitar strings/CL:條|条[tiao2]/radical (chemistry)
prefecture/(old) province/(old) administrative division/state (e.g. of US)/oblast (Russia)/canton (Switzerland)

sentences.english: The state of Michigan already had an agricultural college .
sentences.chinese: 密西根州已有一所農學院。

sentences.english: Kevorkian expects his prices to be competitive with AOL.
sentences.chinese: 密西根州其價格預計將與美國線上競爭。

sentences.english: My aunt used to live in this part of Michigan that was kind of out in the country.
sentences.chinese: 我姑媽曾住在這個國家中密西根州的一個地區。

sentences.english: One of the most famous of these camps is the Interlochen Centre for the Arts in Michigan.
sentences.chinese: 其中最著名的營地之一是密西根州的湖心藝術中心。

sentences.english: The state legislature in Michigan is getting ready to vote on a right-to-work law.
sentences.chinese: 密西根州的立法機構正準備爲即將的工作權利法投票。

sentences.english: A rogue gust of wind tipped over a semi and tore off its roof in Michigan.
sentences.chinese: 密西根州，一場狂風推翻了一輛半掛車，揭去了頂部。

sentences.english: Here's a link to the slew of amicus briefs in the Michigan cases.
sentences.chinese: 連接到密西根州案例中其他利益方陳述的回顧。

pinyin: Bin1 xi1 fa3 ni2 ya4 zhou1
Nan2 Ka3 luo2 lai2 na4 zhou1
Jia1 li4 fu2 ni2 ya4 zhou1
